chess

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
     * This class defines a Player object, which can move a piece from one location on the board to another.  * This class also has implementations for checkmate and stalemate.  * @author Pranav Kanukollu, pvk9  * @author Nishanth Athreya, nsa48  *

      Constructor.

      This method checks if a stalemate is present.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String color)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        color - This is the color of the pieces that the Player moves.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public boolean move(Board b,
                    Location init,
                    Location to,
                    char x,
                    boolean isCopy)
        This method moves a piece from location to another, if it is allowed to do so. This is also where a piece captures another piece of the opposing color, if the other piece is in the final location of the piece. Additionally, this method defines promotion for a pawn when it reaches the other side of the board.
        Parameters:
        b - Board object, where the pieces are being moved on.
        init - This is the initial location of the piece.
        to - This is the final location of the piece.
        x - This is a char, which is used for indicating what piece that pawn should be promoted to.
        isCopy  -
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true or false based on whether the player has successfully moved the piece or not.

      • isCheckMate

        public boolean isCheckMate(Board b)
        This method indicates whether or not it is a checkmate based on whether the king has any valid moves or not.
        Parameters:
        b - Board object, which is used to traverse through the board to see if king has any valid moves.
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true/false indicating whether it is a checkmate or not.

      • isStalemate

        public boolean isStalemate(Board b)
        This method checks if a stalemate is present.
        Parameters:
        b - is the Board.
        Returns:
        boolean indicates if there is a stalemate.
